chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant JORDAN M SMERLING was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: -CASH BOND APPLIED, leaving a balance of $18.00. Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Take all meds as prescribed.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
3:13 PM Defendant JORDAN M SMERLING in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for JORDAN M SMERLING.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with prison sentence and conditions and counts 2 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in. ADA concurs. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-18 months Initial Confinement and 18 months of Extended Supervision. Sentence is to commence immediately.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 

-Court costs. Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
-Take all meds as prescribed.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the GL County Sheriff's Department. 

Court adjourned at 3:25 PM
Review hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Status Report

8:33 AM Defendant JORDAN M SMERLING in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for JORDAN M SMERLING.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Smerling advises the defendant will waive his right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Kapelis. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:35 AM
Return date scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
(Atty Kapelis)
Bond Agency Payments / Check # 11650
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement
